LLM_Sentence: interested in applying for memphis area legal services new landlord-tenant mediation program? call 901-432-4663.
one day last fall, bryant woods rotted-out flooring opened up beneath his 11-year-old daughter.
major leaks in the rental home had allowed mold to thrive and rot to set in.
in the winters, he was forced to use space heaters or his electric oven to stay warm since the heat didnt work.
for years, woods relationship with his longtime landlord has been deteriorating.
in the meantime, he started looking for a new place to live.
he left the courthouse without much hope.

to reduce such evictions, one of the courts judges, deborah henderson; shelby county commissioner erika sugarmon; and cindy ettingoff, then-ceo of memphis area legal services, last summer secured $240,000 in the county budget to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

LLM_Sentence: recently, mals worked with a woman who was living in a house that should not be lived in by anyone and was starting to fall behind on rent, henderson said.
Title_and_Justification_LLM: judge one of the courts judges

LLM_Sentence: it seemed like a case headed toward an eviction for the tenant, a code violation for the landlord or both.
Title_and_Justification_LLM: judge one of the courts judges

LLM_Sentence: but with mals help, the landlord is making repairs, and the tenant is using some leftover rental assistance funds to catch up on rent.

LLM_Sentence: to drum up more business, henderson and mals attorney cedric harris, who is leading the program, have been spending a few nights and weekends this summer speaking to churches, on radio shows and at other events.
Title_and_Justification_LLM: judge one of the courts judges

LLM_Sentence: there are no income limits or income requirements, henderson told a wlok-am audience earlier this summer.

LLM_Sentence: if youre a landlord and you have a troublesome tenant give us a call.
Title_and_Justification_LLM: judge one of the courts judges

LLM_Sentence: henderson believes the program will require a much longer pilot period before its able to produce the proof necessary to create a housing court.
Title_and_Justification_LLM: judge one of the courts judges

LLM_Sentence: but, despite the rough start, she remains very hopeful for its future.
